message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.NE

This paper is about natural language processing (NLP) and corpus linguistics, which are typically categorized under the arXiv sub-category of "Computation and Language" (cs.CL). The paper also discusses the development of guidelines for a conventional orthography, which could fall under the sub-category of "Machine Learning" (cs.LG) since it involves developing rules for automated processing of text. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of morphological analyzers and taggers, which are common tools in information retrieval (cs.IR) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) research. Finally, the paper focuses on a specific dialect of Arabic, which could be of interest to researchers in the sub-category of "Neural and Evolutionary Computing" (cs.NE) who are working on natural language generation or machine translation.
